gov.usgs.anss.edge

Class IndexBlockCheck

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.edge.IndexBlockCheck
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable

    public class IndexBlockCheck
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable
    This class handles index check blocks for Replicators. The physical form is :
    SeedName (12 char)
    node (4 bytes)
    julian (int)
    startingBlock (int), bitmap (long), earliestTime (short), latestTime (short)
    Repeat last MAX_EXTENTS times. This class is used to create confirmed index blocks which are compared to normal index blocks to look for differences between the data confirmed and that which should be present. The IndexFileReplicator maintains a list of these object for each block active in a .chk file. Each block written to the data file causes a markBlockUsed() invocation here to mark block as confirmed. This basically represents a particular check block in a .chk file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IndexBlockCheck

        public IndexBlockCheck(java.lang.StringBuilder name,
               java.lang.StringBuilder nd,
               int blk,
               IndexFileReplicator ifile)
                throws IllegalSeednameException,
                       java.io.IOException
        creates a new instance of IndexBlockCheck for the raw disk block given. The check file block is also read and if the seedname, node, and julian date agree it is used to populate the rest of the block, else all arrays start out empty (no blocks confirmed).
        Parameters:
        name - The seed name to be associated with the file.
        ifile - The previously opened IndexFile to use to read the blocks
        nd - The node of the edge computer originating this file
        blk - The block number in the check file for this index block check
        Throws:
        IllegalSeednameException - if name does not pass MasterBlock.checkSeedName()
        java.io.IOException - If this block cannot be created.

                                     java.util.BitSet blockMap)
        return a detailed string about this index block
        Parameters:
        errOnly - Only list errors
        readData - 0=don't, 1=read and list errors only, 2=read display and list errors
        blockMap - A bit set return with list of extents in use (an extent is 64 blocks long)
        Returns:
        StringBuilder representing this block in detail including errors/inconsistencies found

      • clear

        public void clear()

      • isFullyConfirmed

        public final boolean isFullyConfirmed()
        check fullyConfirmed is set and reevaluate if it is not. A block is fully confirmed when all of its bitmaps are all set (-1 in all MAX_EXTENTS) of them. Once a block is fully confirmed it is generally useless.
        Returns:
        true if this block has all confirmed bits in all extents.

      • updateBlock

        public final boolean updateBlock(java.lang.String use)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        update this block on disk
        Parameters:
        use - A tag to identify who called update block to help with debug logging
        Returns:
        true if this block is complete (all extent bit maps are -1) the fullyConfirmed state.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If one occurs writing the block
